column4: after switching to Firefox 4 on ubuntu, my flash has all sorts of missing chunks, white blocks, and buggy interactivity-- anyone know a solution to this?
i've had problems like that with nspluginwrapper and flash, even before ff4, is it differently bad on different websites? it doesn't support wmode with nspluginwrapper
yeah.. its fine on some websites-- and google chromes flash is almost flawless
im not sure if i have the 32bit plugin, i have Adobe Flash Player plugin for mozilla, which may or may not be that
all i can really suggest is the native plugin, nspluginwrapper has never really worked acceptably for me
if you have an x86_64 install and used flashplugin-installer (the package) instead of manually doing it, you have nspluginwrapper
after you put native in the right place, or even before, be sure to uninstall flashplugin-installer (and nspluginwrapper and stuff should automatically go with it)
im on 64bit ubuntu, do you know which flash package i should get? is it a adobe labs file?
Square i believe, is still the 64bit one
well you can do it in nautilus too, it needs to go into ~/.mozilla/plugins for per user install; theres a place to do it for the whole system but i haven't had the need to look
thanks got that installed ill test it out :)
wow i think that fixed everything
it'll be faster and wmode will work too ;]
